page.title: 17Laundry in Trimley
page.content: Spriteshall Lane in{Trimley St.Mary is known as{Laundry Lane}because there is a large building owned by the {National Sunlight Laundry Company where clothes and linen are washed starched and pressed.The clothes are marked to identify them,put them in baskets and taken to enormous washing machines.Once clean they are dried in tumble driers and taken to be pressed. this is done by women who put the sheets through a giant mangle to iron out the creases.Two more women stand up the other end and fold the sheets. Smaller items like shirts are taken to foam covered models,put on the body and two large padded walls come together and press the shirts.The cuffs and collars are ironed later and then the shirt is carefully folded by machine and packed in polythene bags.
